messages.subject: Re: Kyoto Patrol Districts!!!
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks so much Masayoshi! I ve been wondering about this with the fic I was doing... It s nice to know my instincts were right after all! WEEEE!!!! The
messages.messageBody:
Thanks so much Masayoshi! I've been wondering about this with the
fic I was doing... It's nice to know my instincts were right after
all! WEEEE!!!! The Mimawarigumi's also have a patrol site close to
the our boys, ah you have no idea how easier you made my life get...
Thanks again!!!

ON another note I never did thank you for the Saitou family tree...
Really you are so GREAT!

~wounds


--- In SHQ@yahoogroups.com, "Shimazu Masayoshi" <patriot014@h...>
wrote:

guidebook
> to the NHK series, I found a map of Kyoto with the different
districts
> that the different patrol groups ran, as of July 1866!!! I've
posted a
> sketch of it (I don't have access to a scanner right now) in the
> Photos section!!!
>
> Interesting thing of note-- Shinsengumi didn't patrol a large area,
> but they DID patrol the area around their HQ which included
Shimabara
> (w/courtesans and all), which is on the left side of the map I
posted,
> AND, they patrolled what I think is Gion (the geisha/teahouse
> district), which is the one on the right side. Leave it to our
guys to
> get all the babes....lol
>
> --M.

messages.msgSnippet: That is the most wonderful thing!!! Thank you a million times over for posting it. Now if we could only come across what uniforms or distinguishing things
messages.messageBody:
That is the most wonderful thing!!! Thank you a million times over for
posting it.

Now if we could only come across what "uniforms" or distinguishing
things the other patrol groups wore it would definitely be a writer's
dream come true.

--
Barbara Sheridan

http://www.barbarasheridan.net

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Kyoto Patrol Districts!!!
messages.msgSnippet: ... I imagine Sanosuke wishing Osaka had only been 20 minutes away.  (For anyone who doesn t know or remember why:
messages.messageBody:
Shimazu Masayoshi <patriot014@...> wrote:

>>As for going to Japan, I'm going there next year, and I'll be in Osaka, 20 minutes away from Kyoto.<<

I imagine Sanosuke wishing Osaka had only been 20 minutes away. (For anyone who doesn't know or remember why: http://www.geocities.com/spiritus_saitou/poke_in_butt.htm )

I'm so envious. One of my daughter's close friends is currently in Japan, but I'm not sure where he is and it's only for a month. How long are you going to be there, M.?

>>Keep us updated on your work! If there's anything (sketches, etc.), you've done so far, please show us!<<

Definitely! If you haven't done it already, be sure to join up over on the fic/art section, shq_spy_division, and indulge both yourself and everyone else at your whim.

phil

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Re: Kyoto Patrol Districts!!!
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you very much! *grins* I ve been working on it for a long while. At first, it was based on the Ishin Shishi, but then I fell in love with the
messages.messageBody:
Thank you very much! *grins* I've been working on it for a long while. At first, it was based on the Ishin Shishi, but then I fell in love with the Shinsengumi. I'll post some pics as soon as I can! Also, the link is http://www.fictionpress.com/read.php?storyid=1519468.

I want to read yours too! It's really hard finding Shinsengumi fans nowadays. *sighs* I'm really glad that this group has been started and all. Keep the fandom alive and long live the Shinsengumi! ^.^x

messages.messageBody:
You're doing a Shinsengumi manga too?! Wow! I'm working on a
novel/manga myself.

As for going to Japan, I'm going there next year, and I'll be in
Osaka, 20 minutes away from Kyoto.

Keep us updated on your work! If there's anything (sketches, etc.),
you've done so far, please show us!

--M.

messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Kyoto Patrol Districts!!!
messages.msgSnippet: Really? That s uber-sugoi! OMG that ll definitely send a big leap for my manga. And when I go to Japan someday I ll be sure to check out those areas while in
messages.messageBody:
Really? That's uber-sugoi! OMG that'll definitely send a big leap for my manga. And when I go to Japan someday I'll be sure to check out those areas while in Shinsengumi uniform. Wow! Now I have more to visit than just Kyoto and Mibu...

I ought to start saving! I'll do some more research and see if I can't find anything else interesting to send back to you as a thanks for that ^.^x

messages.subject: Kyoto Patrol Districts!!!
messages.msgSnippet: You guys!!!! (jumps up and down) Get this! On page 7 of the guidebook to the NHK series, I found a map of Kyoto with the different districts that the different
messages.messageBody:
You guys!!!! (jumps up and down) Get this! On page 7 of the guidebook
to the NHK series, I found a map of Kyoto with the different districts
that the different patrol groups ran, as of July 1866!!! I've posted a
sketch of it (I don't have access to a scanner right now) in the
Photos section!!!

Interesting thing of note-- Shinsengumi didn't patrol a large area,
but they DID patrol the area around their HQ which included Shimabara
(w/courtesans and all), which is on the left side of the map I posted,
AND, they patrolled what I think is Gion (the geisha/teahouse
district), which is the one on the right side. Leave it to our guys to
get all the babes....lol

--M.
